website_summaries.verdict: Arlo has outdone themselves with their most feature-packed and picture-perfect camera to date, but a security system that exclusively utilizes Arlo Ultras will be a costly setup.
cons: Arlo’s best camera is also the priciest

website_summaries.verdict: Arlo's Ultra camera impresses with advanced features and solid performance, but the high price won't work for everyone's budget.
pros: The Ultra improves on Arlo's last-gen indoor/outdoor security cameras with 4K streaming, auto-zooming and -tracking and a larger 180-degree field of view
It works with Alexa and Google Assistant -- and has person, package, vehicle and animal detection
Arlo gives Ultra customers a free one-year subscription to the Arlo Smart service
cons: It costs $600 for a two-camera pack
Its 4K resolution takes up a lot of bandwidth and may not mesh well with your current Wi-Fi setup if your connection is spotty
The seven-day free cloud storage Arlo offers on its other cameras is not available with the Ultra

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is not even 720p. I called the arlo support and they went through all of the steps to see if my internet was the issue, the distance from the modem, software updates, etc. However, the issue has not been resolved. We had a prowler come on to our property but we were unable to identify him by his face, as you can see on the photo, That was the reason why we bought the product and it failed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: One Word - NO 4K ever
customer_reviews.text: Have had Arlos from the beginning. The quality of the video is a joke on these 4K UHDs. I have never managed to view anything even resembling 1080p. 95% percent of the time the video is a splotchy mess. Cameras are within 10 feet of base station.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph Kummer

customer_reviews.title: NOT backwards compatible with existing base stations
customer_reviews.text: The previous cameras were all compatible with the older base stations. The new Ultra model is not. I had bought just the camera as an add on and was surprised to find that if I wanted to use it I'd have to purchase a new base station-- NOT something I wanted to do. Very disappointed that Arlo deviated from past practice with this new camera.
customer_reviews.author: christine m.

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could read license plates on cars that pulled into my driveway. 15 feet away and you cannot see any of the plate. Total garbage waste of money. Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Poor support for product
customer_reviews.text: Had to call multiple times to resolve an issue that Ultra cameras were not recording.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Borkowski

customer_reviews.title: Offline twice on the first night
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just installed it tonight, and it has already went offline twice within one hour. It doesn’t help even after I’ve moved the base station closer to the camera. I will keep monitor and update this review if there’s any improvement
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4K does not deliver
customer_reviews.text: So compared to my previous Arlo 2 model this new HD is clearer in resolution but does not deliver readable license plates or a clear image of people as the demo showed. So for the price of the package and the deliverables don’t deliver
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Yoshihara

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want siren functionality
customer_reviews.text: This is falsely advertised as having a siren. It doesn't. It has a speaker, that measured indoors, from 2 feet barely reaches 70db. My iphone is WAY louder than it. To give you some idea - it didn't even wake up my dog, who was sleeping 10 feet away from it, when I was testing it. And it's not faulty unit - I tested all 4 cameras. And I did speak with support, and did troubleshooting - that's how loud they're on the "extreme loud".
customer_reviews.author: Marcin Kwiatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Great system, you have to be realistic!!
customer_reviews.text: Got it from the very first release and did not have any issues at all. Yes some did, but I have been pleased from the start. Mixed in with my pro 2 cameras and had no issues with setup or connection. Very pleased. The only con was I had to wait so long to write my review.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Alley

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using arlo pro 2 cameras around my house which has been wonderful. I wanted to later expand my arlo system when they bring out their security sensors but you need the new hub for that so i got one ultra/hub combo. When i synced all cameras to the new hub the battery life diminished *drastically* all cameras were dead within days, maybe a week. Im slowly working with arlo support to see if this can be remedied. When syncing all but ultra camera back to old hub battery life went back to normal. If this can be fixed on the new hub i will change review to higher rating. For now, ultra is not great.
customer_reviews.author: g24

customer_reviews.title: Great features, good wide angle, good night vision. No really usable 4 K.
customer_reviews.text: All features I have tried so far are working as promised, except the very limited 4K access. The 4 K can only be accomplished if on the same wifi network as the hub, which eliminates any remote access to 4 K video. Otherwise, the video quality, battery life, person and animal detection are all working well.
customer_reviews.author: Maj C. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: First Arlos
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 camera Ultra setup. I’m switching from Nest. The resolution is crystal clear, and the wire free setup is quick and easy. I’m impressed with battery life so far, especially since one of the cameras faces a driveway with a lot of movement throughout the day. It took a bit to program a more complicated schedule with the modes, but it’s easy once you realize how to do it. The only thing that doesn’t seem to work is the motion activity zones, which don’t seem to make any difference whatsoever in what the camera detects.
customer_reviews.author: PDX Oregon

customer_reviews.title: I'll probably return this.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it some time, but I'll return this before the return window expires if things don't change. Right now, the battery burns down to 0% during the day because get this: The camera wont charge when it's hot outside. Meaning during the summer, this camera is USELESS between the hours of 2pm-nighttime even when hard plugged into the wall. Sometimes, it never recharges and I have to swap the battery with a different camera from inside. What Arlo needs to do: Put out a firmware fix that allows charging during higher temperatures. I guarantee it wont happen and I'll be boxing this up. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Small package - large value
customer_reviews.text: To sum it up: Wireless, 4K capable, audio, and a motion light packed in a little package. Only thing I would request is color selection from the manufacturer for the price being paid and shell made of plastic. Aftermarket skins are not worth it and mounting hardware from Arlo being all white does not lead it self to blend in with mounting surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Welcome to the Family!
customer_reviews.text: We depend on these for keeping an eye on things. We are in the country and whether it's a package or a mischievous raccoon or opossum, we want to know what's going on. With the addition now of the solar panel, we will be making fewer ladder trips.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Use for home security, inside and out. Works great for me. I bought 2 4-camera packs and a 2-camera pack. Each pack came with a smarthub so I have outside and basement cameras on one hub, set to be always active, and the other inside cameras on the other hub, set to be only on when we're sleeping. I also got a charging stand and two extra batteries so I always have fully charged batteries to swap out depleted batteries without having a camera down while it's battery is charging.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: A non starter as an upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Previous versions (original, pro and pro2) worked well and were easy to install and use. I bought this as an upgrade to my existing system. Removing cameras from the old system as preparation for installing the upgrade was easy. However the smart hub won’t sync with the cameras or with my new ultra cameras. The old cameras won’t sync to the old hub either now. They blink as if they have been synced but don’t appear in the app or on my.arlo. So I am basically left with cameras that can’t be attached to either system.
customer_reviews.author: ranmo

customer_reviews.title: Poor Video
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality video. I have a much cheaper Amcrest camera that has a better picture, Kept losing the video feed and lots of freezing. I'm returning it today. To much money for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT 4K!!! TREMENDOUS FAIL
customer_reviews.text: The app sucks. The video quality sucks AND you have to have a monthly subscription to use the crap product. The original iPhone has a better picture than this POS. I’m insulted that they say it’s 4K. There is no way this is even 1080! Look at the screen cap. Does that look like 4K? Are there some settings I’m missing in the SUPER basic app you might ask? No Carol there is nothing missed. See the screen cap of the app for yourself. It’s GARBAGE. I should be paid for the time waisted. I spit in their general direction.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stimpsom

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem like 4K
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these cameras. They do a good job but I have a hard time believing the actually record in 4K. I set the cameras to record in the highest quality and when I pause a recording I can barely make out my own face much less someone else’s. I guess I’ll resign myself to the fact that this is nothing more than a really expensive early warning system so I have time to grab my gun and call the police.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Not a good deal in the long run.
customer_reviews.text: While this product is good, the deal is not. These cameras do not have a dvr to store your videos. As such, you get a free year of motion detected cloud storage then in cost approx $100/ yr. If you want continuous video monitoring, you pay approx an additional $100/yr per camera for 15 days continuous cloud storage. In short, I paid a high price for 2 cameras that would cost me an additional $200 the first year and an additional $300 for each following year for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arlo Ultra is full of problems
customer_reviews.text: I've had Arlo Pro camaras and those were pretty good and reliable. The ULTRA cameras are extremely unreliable. Battery levels are not reported correctly and sometimes they charge, sometimes they don't. Sometimes they go offline for no reason. My feeling is that the connection to power method they are using for these ultra cameras (magnetic) is a poor system. The magnet connection must transfer through the plastic housing and then to more connectors inside the case. I would recommend other Arlo cameras - but these ULTRA cameras are no good.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy L.

customer_reviews.title: Better video than the pro but zones does not work
customer_reviews.text: The good: The video quality is better than the pro. The bad: Zones is pretty much useless. Even if you set up a zone for, say, your front door, the camera will still alert on everything it sees including the areas outside of the alert zones. One star for motion detection until this is fixed. The frustrating: Setup forces a firmware base station update check every time one adds a new device. If you are "upgrading" from an older base station and have, say a couple of cameras and a doorbell, you will be rewarded with around 20 minutes of "checking base station firmware". I may adjust the rating once they fix the zones "feature"
customer_reviews.author: ChrisnLisa

customer_reviews.title: poor video quality
customer_reviews.text: the response is very slow and video quality is poor comparing with many other camera. the smart base also needs to restart almost every week
customer_reviews.author: Abdulla Alemadi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and they work great!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a previous version, and it was slow and a bit painful to set up. These, however, are much faster and easier to set up and configure. The picture is tremendously better than previous versions. They come with two ways of mounting them. Another cool feature is that you can charge them with a connector that attaches with a magnet. And the batteries last got a good long while after charging. I recommend these cameras, even if they seem to be a little bit expensive. They are attractive, easy to use, and very convenient, and they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve973

customer_reviews.title: Lag Time and TOO EXPENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: In my 8 mts of owning the Arlo ULTRA 4k camera, I am not happy with the quality of the video's and the 30-50 second lag time receiving the video. In viewing videos of concern when zooming in to identify the person the image becomes blurry and of no use. If the individual is within 5-10 feet, during daytime, its not a problem. But, over 10 feet away if I zoom in all I can identify is the persons hair color and skin color. Night vision videos are worse. I would not recommend the Arlo ULTRA for video quality. TOO EXPENSIVE to have a lag time and blurry video/images when zooming in.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Customer Service Poor................
customer_reviews.text: I judge a companies product by the customer service. Arlo is very unsatisfactory. I had read in other reviews of poor customer service and I realize how some folks could be misleading. They are right. After 6 months having issues with one camera(other working perfect) talked to three representatives, all guiding me in different direction. The bottom line after hours of my time, they agreed to replace. The rgr had me paying up front , or funding the freight to send back there warranty product. No Thanks. The good thing I purchased the extended warranty and when this completely fails. I hope to cash in and get a system that works and has a better customer service...
customer_reviews.author: Eddie H Mabe

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I received a defective set
customer_reviews.text: These are not like the previous cameras. I’m not going to write a lengthy review. I have used Arlo cameras for years and recommended them to others. However, these are very disappointing. The signal strength is poor, I have tested the cameras by walking from right to left and left to right and they don’t capture my movements. Maybe I just received a defective set; I have not called tech support. In my opinion, if your looking for security, knowing what is going on around your property, I can not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: William Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Hight Tech  CCTV System Done Right.
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed, researched and compared various video surveillance camera sets before settling on Arlo. Like many people and electronic pundits have said/written, it is very expensive - but worth every penny, in my opinion. The videos analytics features alone are worth the price of admission. Beyond that, the brilliance of the color and "night mode" images are stunning. The actulal system set up and Amazon Alexa integration was easy and seemless. I highly recommend the Arlo system; if price is a big issue, I suggest starting with the two-camera set and then expand gradually from there.
customer_reviews.author: T. U.

customer_reviews.title: Several technical issues, virtually no support.
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection will pick up every single thing regardless of of what settings you use. Support is in India and the Philippines only (no USA support). Arlo doesn’t give their support staff the tools needed to help with anything. Be very cautious in buying this product. If something doesn’t work as advertised, you’ll talk to a lot of nice people who have virtually no power to fix anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We love how it keeps us safe and alerts even the small things if we wish like animals. We have seen fox and possum pass on our deck. LOL! I especially love being able to speak to the person outside at my door if we are away from home. That rocks and startled them. LOL. Only thing is it takes quite a bit of time from the moment someone is at the door to the time you pull it up on your screen from app. There is a delay and sometimes they are already walking away. Lag time sucks for that part. Otherwise we would buy over again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna G

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Camera system out there
customer_reviews.text: Great image quality, great sound quality, easy set up, easy app controls with lots of intuitive features. Minor complaints. Siren is way to quiet, consistent 3 second delay (I’m sure do to it being wireless. I purchased end of May and my system is not glitchy or problematic. They must have fixed with firmware updates. It’s good now. I have a good quality FIOS WiFi network at home. I recommend
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Every thing about these cameras are poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have owned these since July 2019. The batteries no longer charge unless I reset the whole system, remove the batteries, and then re-add the cameras. The two magnetic mounts have rusted and fallen apart. One was on a covered porch and the other under an eave. Ridiculous. I have done everything suggested. Incredible waste of almost $800 dollars. The video is okay but certainly not 4K; cameras don't turn on quick enough either. Buy something else. Don't waste your money. No idea where all the good reviews actually came from.
customer_reviews.author: S. Masters

customer_reviews.title: 4k? Plugged in constantly and battery is stuck at 85% for a week
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is not 4k even though I am close to the base station. I am paying for CVR and have not been able to look at my data for days now and my camera seems stuck at 85%. I emailed tech support and opened a case they asked several questions but the link to respond through arlo kept giving an error. Definitely thinking Nest is probably better and their monthly costs are way less
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good, but....
customer_reviews.text: These are very good cameras. But they do seem to go into excessive long pauses for no apparent reason. The Android app is much more stable than than the Windows 10 version. I particularly like the ultra wide mode of the Arlo Ultra. But I am very disappointed that this camera cannot read licence plates even when in 4K mode. Another very annoying quirk is their tech support because they (Arlo) seem to think that this COVID-19 crises is a fair excuse to cut back on support staff. If you call for tech support, expect a wait of 1 to 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie A

customer_reviews.title: Motion Detection Range is Limited tbout 20 feet
customer_reviews.text: If you need a camera to detect motion greater than 20 feet away, the Arlo is not for you. They use infrared (IR) technology to detect objects warmer than the background environment. Although this may be good enough for many applications, it does not work beyond 20 feet. My garage is farther than that from the camera so this did not capture any motion. Other brands that don't rely on IR can do this reliably. This important information is not listed in the features here. I only found out after the fact on their website. IR Motion detection won't work for me and I am returning. FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Dunham

customer_reviews.title: worst camera ever! scam for thsi price
customer_reviews.text: the camera won't be online with a base within 25ft. When the camera was installed outside the home, the battery drained down in 24 hours! customer support claims battery lasting for 3 months and base-camera distance 300 ft - big lies. Maybe it is worth of $100 a piece but for $300, $500 or $ 900, this is a scam well orchestrated by Arlo and Amazon. The customer support goes to China and we know how it goes! Nothing wrong with the people but lots of false claims.
customer_reviews.author: Ramz

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, bad support
customer_reviews.text: Both cameras failed in less than a year. I’ve been struggling horribly with Arlo’s support team for 2 months. After 10+ emails and 5+ calls they’ve only shipped one replacement camera to me and claim they need to call me to ship the other one. They won’t call. They say me calling them doesn’t count- Someone will call shortly. They never do. These cameras weren’t great when they were working, so to deal with their support is too much. Don’t buy these. Don’t buy any Arlo products. They don’t stand up to weather and their support team is the worst I’ve ever dealt with. It’s like they’re specially trained to waste my time.
customer_reviews.author: Mattomatic

customer_reviews.title: Useless without expensive cloud services
customer_reviews.text: The hardware portion is fine. But the software renders it useless, their free app is inconvenient no thumbnails and not easily secured from a remote location. I really regret buying into their hardware as they are clearly only interested in selling customers an expensive cloud service which at 14.99 a month makes this a money pit. It is regrettable since their hardware is good, but they are no longer the best and after their free software trial expires, the hardware becomes as useful as bricks. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: You would think for the cost, this camera would actually work. To be fair, I loved the idea of the whole thing....what was promised, the features, the magnetic attaching and recharging of the batteries. The problem is that when you go to view your video on the app, it spins and IF it ever picks up, it takes a full minute to show the video on the screen. Second, if you didn't have the camera within 10-15 yards and in the same room, the wifi connection was totally poor. I ended up returning it and getting a Blink camera for 1/4 the cost and it works amazing. Arlo has some serious work to do.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product, Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Call tech supports the very first day because both motion and audio not working. Once motion work, it doesn't detect correctly. If someone robs your house, you can only see it for 10 seconds of randomness even when you selected to be recorded until the motion stop. Call tech support again and they said the max camera could record is 120 seconds. But it's not continuously recording it one right after another. Poor audio quality as well. The living room is about 300-400 sq ft but you can't really hear what other people said on the other end. Don't buy...you're just going to waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Great features but not all are reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive system in terms of its features but it's buggy. Motion detection is unreliable: it will miss people but send me alerts for animals, even though I did not check animals on the list of alerts. Geofencing seems to work well with multiple devices after some playing around. Battery life is not so good unless the wifi signal is strong ("good" is not good enough). Tech support is very good. They've been very helpful to me
customer_reviews.author: Providence person

customer_reviews.title: Arlo ultra
customer_reviews.text: I have an ultra with a pro 2 addon camera and so far i love them both especially the ultra with the wide view and 4k its amazing. The pro 2 camera is no slouch as well. Both wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this is you want to be able to see any details in the videos.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to capture details on suspicious vehicles on my street. This camera does NOT allow you to get the license plate or model of a vehicle. The advertising is blatantly deceptive. It does do a pretty good job of alerting me to motion on the street. I have added a game camera with just a 2M pixel camera that does allow enough detail to record license plate and model. It may be a 4K camera (and I am storing the videos on the hub with SD card), but it does not capture videos at anything close to 4K. This issue had been reported by many users.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Schlaffer

customer_reviews.title: Ultra
customer_reviews.text: I don't think the camera detects as much farther distance than the Pro/Pro2
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Security
customer_reviews.text: The quality, features, audio, video, night vision, and 4K are all very postage qualties with the ultra.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Warner

customer_reviews.title: 180 FOV, HD Images!  Support for glitchy set-up?
customer_reviews.text: Love the 180 degree field of view, HD images, and strong motion detection, plus the added benefit of a light. However, though set-up was relatively easy, it required a little trial and error to determine how motion detection was to be recorded on the cloud. Still not sure I have it correct, but at least it is working for now. Support is not available, so relying on FAQs and they don't always address the specific problem, or difficult to find.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good motion detection
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for about a week and camera have been reliable and accurate with motion alerts. Picture clarity is great and spotlight is added security feature. Only downside was only two magnetic mounts being included with three camera pack.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Night vision is Great but you will need to turn off the Spot light on the camera. Turn on an outside light if you can or add some Motion detection Lights. The Spot Light on the Camera USES A LOT OF BATTERY LIFE. My Arlo Pros used to go many months Stationed up on a Tree. My new Arlo Ultra's only go for about 2 to 3 weeks. Now doing a Test with out the Spot light on the Camera. ( Mr. Beams has a very good supply of Spot lights )
customer_reviews.author: Fred Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and watched the video reviews prior to purchasing. I was disappointed it had to be plugged in for maximum features but I just wanted a good clear picture. The picture was grainy and did not offer the detection I expected. Unless the area you are monitoring is within 30 feet of the camera, look elsewhere. When contacting customer service, it was substandard for my issue and the nail in the coffin for returning the system. Could it be a good system for you? Maybe. It was not for me.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctions, Support Service Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These cameras malfunction constantly . Support Service is terrible. Left on hold for hours. When prompted to leave a call back number you never receive a call back. If malfunction happens when you are away , there is no way to fix remotely on your computer. Strongly suggest finding an alternate system than ARLO. Expensive and useless.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Video is not 4k, and cameras stop recording and need to be reset periodically
customer_reviews.text: Video is not 4k, and cameras stop recording and need to be reset periodically I've contact support several times, and after resetting the cameras to factory default and readd them it will work again. Not really a practical solution, when you need a ladder to take down the cameras and only find out it wasn't recording after you try to view something and can't.
customer_reviews.author: Nick from Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Does as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my home when the stay at home order happened and I had to work from home. We had to use our homes outgoing mail more than normal and I wanted to keep an eye on the mail I put out. These did what I expected and help me keep an eye on the outside of my home. Now that things are back to normal (mostly) for our home, they are still handy for keeping an eye on the outside of the house, cars, mail, etc.
customer_reviews.author: SHERRY M DAUGHERTY

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Kinda pricey but work great. Oicks uo great have never had any problems with them. Charge last about 2 weeks at my house but they do go off alot. Flashlight on them is really handy acts as a motion detector spot light its great. I don't care for the color night vision doesn't seem as clear as black and white. Library works great. Don't have anything right beside or top of it or most of the night vision will brighten there not out in front at a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Amussue

customer_reviews.title: Only for US market, not compatible to other regions voltage
customer_reviews.text: This product is a joke. I'm convinced that most of the positive reviews are fake / bought. Let me highlight some of the issues, using the latest firmware: - Live local streaming (not via their cloud) is SLOW. It has a 30+ sec lag and the image is freezing from time to time. Useless. - Cannot connect to camera microphone when using local live streaming. Useless. - Failed to get the status of the Hub Station, from time to time. - Failing to save camera settings, from time to time. - The Siren volume is so low, you can barely hear it. - AC Adapter Input advertised as 100-240V, but it's only 100-120V.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Torj-Kobza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video, but...
customer_reviews.text: The video is superior, especially at night when the automatic motion light comes on. A couple of issues to prevent 5 stars. The Two-way audio is cumbersome. It takes a while to load and it’s difficult to hear. My voice is is barely audible and the other side is almost non existent. A microphone upgrade would fix this. Also, the magnetic camera mount isn’t great. There’s a tiny screw and piece of plastic to mount the magnet on. It’s a powerful magnet, but when I took the camera off to charge, it ripped out the plastic piece holding the mount.
customer_reviews.author: wejamn

customer_reviews.title: overall pretty good camera system as long as you are not trying to also send it out too far.
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is very good even from a phone. Able to record local, cloud, or both. Does an excellent job of letting you know if something it sees is an animal, vehicle, or person. Very good sound quality for a security camera. The wireless range is good but is definitely the place they need to put the next advancements into.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: SUPPORT IS GETTING BETTER
customer_reviews.text: WISH RANGE COULD GO FURTHER NO BETTER RANGE FOR SMART HUB THAN PRO 2 HUB
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - zero customer service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Arlo Ultra system Sept 2019. Everything worked great for a month. We had 1 camera completely die. We contacted Arlo customer service, and we still have not heard back from them. We completed all the steps listed on their support website (since there are many of complaints about this) with no success. After 4 months of use, the entire system failed. The cameras do not record motion, and the hub will disconnect. Again, we submitted a customer service ticket (several times), and we have not heard back from Arlo. We completed the steps listed on the website to correct this issue (since this is a common issue) with no success. Do not buy this system.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Amesome cameras
customer_reviews.text: alro ultra is one of the best wireless security camera out. Super sharp videos and very easy to use and setup. My number 1 concern is the battery life. Last about 2 weeks before it needs charging so i bought a long power adapter and that fix all the probelms. Number 2 is prolly the app at times but it doesnt really bother me. Waiting for a update on it. Other then that its a amazing camera. Best pick up for me for 2020.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and install
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to set up some cameras for the back and side yards without having to run wiring. After spending time researching what it would take to tie into existing lights for power, I opted for Arlo for its battery operation. While I would love for it to have continuous recording capabilities and full timeline review. the clips are ok for these areas. Setup and installation were super easy, and the option to charge via solar accessory is huge.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice camera in general. This is my main surveillance camera and works perfect for me. Good field of view and nice night vision with the light. I use power supply to avoid charging in busy area. nice audio n speaker plus integrated alarm. The quality picture is ok but not sure if my internet is not helping. Cons: I don't like to have to pay for subscription, 5$ a month. I bought the smart hub from HSN and still paying this camera and the hub monthly. other than that i love the camera and 4k whenever my internet works.
customer_reviews.author: Reyi

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want it for
customer_reviews.text: If you want it as a "notification" system at CLOSE range/short distance viewing its GREAT!!! If you want it as overall whole home viewing/live streaming with ease then its HORRIBLE. Clarity at distance is useless. The software needs a complete overhaul!! Cameras are only as good as the people who watch/review them OR the software that makes that process easy.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these cameras after a lot of research. Setup was incredibly easy, no drilling or wires involved. Security system was set up within 10 minutes of opening the box. Great video quality and two-way sound. The app is easy to use and has great features. This also came with a one-year complimentary service plan, and there are many inexpensive accessories available on Amazon. Very pleased with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Troubleshooting is not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The base station has to be hardwired into a router, so if you need to reach cameras positioned outdoors, you’ll almost certainly need a wifi extender that has an ethernet port. Even then, there's a noticeable lag of up to 20 seconds with viewing in real-time. Nightvision seems be very easily tricked by my neighbors flood lights. Getting support is painful. You can't respond directly to emails. Submitting forms on their support page don't actually seem to update the ticket (when the form submission goes through at all).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I've been researching security cameras for awhile. A friend had Arlos and I was impressed with the quality. The entire setup, including mounting the cameras took less than an hour. I will say, the camera showed less than half battery left after 24 hours, but at the end of 7 days, there was still 24% battery left. I ordered the solar panels and am very happy with how it is working. Nobody is going to get near the house with these things up. The motion detectors are sensitive. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cespedes

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Easy to install, setup and configure.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Batteries last for more than 3 months (just configure the motion detection and cameras led properly). Super easy to setup and configure the cameras. Camera range surprised me and image quality is also very good. Keep in mind that all you have is a digital zoom, so you should maintain low expectations about it. However if well positioned, cameras are super useful.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro Eidi Villela Assano

customer_reviews.title: Won’t buy any more
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a number of the various Arlo cameras but will no buy any more. I like the cameras but no longer trust NetGear. I had a number of VueZone cameras and NetGear discontinued support. I’m sure that someday when they have a new line of cameras, they will discontinue support of the Arlo line of cameras. Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Hadley E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Upgraded Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it since it was advertised 4K UHD. Thought, it will be better/improved the video. However, it was degraded from the previous version Arlo Pro 2. More importantly for this review, after 10 month usage, the battery only lasted 2 days (only few activities). The battery quality for this model is the worse one I have from previous model. I will stop buying these security cameras, and looking into other competitors' products.
customer_reviews.author: LSN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection, at best, completely sucks. It doesn’t go back on recording when motion is detected. It stops recording while you are still in front of it. It doesn’t pick up vehicles in my driveway every time. Reception from hub to camera is disappointing; it struggles with 40 feet and one wall. The lag is like 10-12 seconds. Spent too much money to be having these issues
customer_reviews.author: C. Brasel

customer_reviews.title: Not a significant bump up from Pro2
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few months now. I've checked and rechecked my settings but so far there's not a significant difference in video quality. Sharp is hardly the word I would use to describe the image quality. The "spotlight" was a big selling point for me, but only activates approximately at 8-10ft away (which isn't far when considering guest/intruder proximity) and is the intensity and coverage of turning your cell phone light on. Mildly helpful. The noise cancelling is helpful. Not sure if it was worth the purchase price considering you have to upgrade the base station from Pro 2.
customer_reviews.author: Hjoyowen

customer_reviews.title: Expensive fail
customer_reviews.text: on day 2, can I return it? Since I spent the money figured I would buy "top of the line" Been nothing but frustrating. The signal strength from the base station to the cameras is pitiful. Spent hours moving the station around to try and get a decent signal to the cameras. The activity zone to set and detect motion completely doesn't work. So now every time a car goes by I get an alert. Maybe I can put some tape over the expensive camera lens to block the road off. Seriously disappointed with my purchase. Thought I would add a doorbell but not now. Will start tooking for a similar wired system with app.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Arlo
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed, finicky, not consistent operation, take forever to connect even with my very strong WIFI. Eats battery time even on conservative settings. "Spot light" is worthless just drains battery, same for "siren," both are a joke. IMO a waste of money there are better cameras out there for the same cost.
customer_reviews.author: BaumBay

customer_reviews.title: Steer Clear.
customer_reviews.text: Had the Ultra 2 camera system for about 6 months now. One was defective off the bat. After many extremely long phone calls with support they admitted the camera was bad but refused to replace it. It took posting on their public forum about how awful my experience was to get them to replace it. Now, a few months later the replacement has stopped working in an entirely different way. Dreading having to deal with their support again.
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: good surveillance
customer_reviews.text: This product works very well daytime and night time for surveillance and watching a property. I don’t like the idea of having to pay $10 a month after the first year is over after I paid 500+ for the system but it does work pretty well
customer_reviews.author: Harry Beezle

customer_reviews.title: love the new Arlo Ultra System
customer_reviews.text: Love the new color night vision that lights up the area, and that you can turn on the lights with your phone ! Its great for wireless situations. And the fact that the images and video are stored in the cloud off the premises, but always there when you need it . This system has put two buglers behind bars already in the last year , and that was with the Arlo Pro 2 .
customer_reviews.author: Bradley R. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy software updates break system and you spend weeks trying to get support
customer_reviews.text: Three weeks and over 1k in. I got 4 cameras, 3 worked initially and one worked then downed pink and green then next day would show distorted blue and brown. After 3 weeks back and forth with arlo support they are replacing 1 camera. Then in December the cameras took a update and I have one that will not detect motion at night while plugged in. The answer I’d the update canned activity zones and detection and they won’t detect motion at night unless battery powered. Bad support, if the cameras actually work a forced software update breaks. Now I get to spend 3 another three weeks with arlo support on this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money but..
customer_reviews.text: The description does not explain you will only see half the systems potential unless you give up your included 1 year of cloud service that is only good for 2k. Then you have to buy the 4k Elite plan to get the 4k recording and streaming. A great ploy to sell your cloud service but enough to keep me fro. Recommending this system to anyone else to buy. I find this deceitful
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easy to instal land operate.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a 6 camera system for security purposes around the outside eo my house. Once the Home Hub was located in a position that was best for all cameras the installation was simple and performance has been outstanding. The Hub did loose communication for no reason I could identify and the hub needed to be reset. This meant setting up the system from scratch again. Tech support was ver knowledgable and patient through the process. Great product ad service!
customer_reviews.author: Maya Picado

customer_reviews.title: Arlo cameras with a lot of flexibility
customer_reviews.text: I have three Arlo cameras and each one has a slightly different need. Easily customizable to each area I’ve installed them. Being able to customize the activity zone also is a big help. I have shrubs that move a lot in an area of my yard, with the activity zone adjusted, it saves from having too many unnecessary recordings. As for the 4K recordings, I can see faces and zoom in to see details quite well. I truly don’t have a complaint about the system I have.
customer_reviews.author: SGSB

customer_reviews.title: Simple to attach to posts, walls and trees.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 3 camera system - easy install and synced to my mobile devices. Picture quality is very clear as well as color. I have been unable to generate an alarm horn still working on that. Otherwise it has met my expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Lalli

customer_reviews.title: System Is Working
customer_reviews.text: But we needed to do quite a bit of tech/trouble shooting to get the entire system working properly. Some of it may have to do with our WiFi service and being in a rural area. My husband had the patience to troubleshoot and figure out why things weren't communicating and linking up. Now it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: shc

customer_reviews.title: Arlo is the BEST
customer_reviews.text: We have been looking for a good camera/doorbell combination system for several months. There are a lot out there. And a lot of them have a lot of shortcomings. Arlo ULTRA has everything we wanted including double authentication to cut down on possible hackers. The visual quality is OUTSTANDING! Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Arlo does not take care of their customers.
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective unit that would not set up. After spending over 2 1/2 hours on the phone with Amazon and Arlo tech support they determined the hub was defective. Arlo offered to replace the part but wanted me to pay shipping both ways ($35.00). Sent it back to Amazon at no charge.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, but not without issues
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the features, the activity Zones, and the ability to silence certain notifications, like vehicles. I am disappointed by the 4K camera though because I was expecting to be able to read license plates of cars in the street, but I can’t. I also think advertising it as a 4K camera is misleading because you either need to install a microSD card or sign up for an expensive subscription to get 4K results.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Bahle

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Picture and sound are amazing!! Though, I’m not looking forward to mounting the cameras. I’m not a fan of putting holes in my siding. I’m having difficulties trying to: figure out the right spot, so to not mar the structure of the house, out of reach enough so to not get stolen, but easily accessible to charge the battery.
customer_reviews.author: CLT David F

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.text: 4K is not much of an improvement over the other Arlo cameras. The camera doesn’t have the clarity that I expected out of a 4K camera, and it’s obviously worse at night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried to cancel order after seen the in action.
customer_reviews.text: ULTRA Sucks... an ARLO money maker. They consistently fails and loose connections especially out doors. Not bad in the same room as the base.
customer_reviews.author: George Walton

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Camera System
customer_reviews.text: The price for the Arlo items is the highest in the market. That being said we are pleased with out system, it was easy to install, easy to setup and the app makes it easy to monitor the system home or away. I would make sure your home has a very good internet speed prior to purchasing as the Ultra camera requires a lot of bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: Willy G.

customer_reviews.title: Follow up
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new one, but when I received the product,it’s look like a second-hand and scratch! Have any after-sakes service can solve this problem, I can’t unacceptable this defect product.
customer_reviews.author: Kai hong cheng

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Mind
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Arlo camera system to find out what was destroying our landscaping. However what it has given us is a feeling of complete safety not only when away but at night while sleeping. It was extremely easy to set up, easy and quick to make any changes from our iPhones. The range of camera to base station is incredible. All of our cameras are mounted outside of our home with 2 being in trees in our front yard! Arlo was the right choice!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda E Dvorak

customer_reviews.title: Would Skip for Now
customer_reviews.text: Hardware is nice, and battery life is great, BUT support is overseas and AWFUL. Software is way behind other companies. Not worth the price tag! If I could return after fighting with company for months I would!!
customer_reviews.author: T4Viral

customer_reviews.title: A fine product
customer_reviews.text: Works mostly as expected. I'm disappointed that HomeKit is missing, even though it is an advertised feature. 5 Stars when HomeKit is implemented. EDIT 12/11/2019. HomeKit has now appeared in my Home app. Rating adjusted upward accordingly. As other have mentioned, the Arlo app has many more features that Apple's Home app. Nevertheless, it's nice to be able to see the camera views on Apple Home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Signature required? NOT!
customer_reviews.text: ....all I can say is that it arrived a day early...and, it was a good thing I actually was at home.....that is, I was home when it was "handed directly to resident"....which it definitely was not....unless they mean the dog. I mean, wtf Amazon?! A high-priced item like this left on my doorstep. I'll actually do the rating for this item later....still more than a bit perturbed by it all......
customer_reviews.author: HerMommy

customer_reviews.title: Nice 4K Camera system
customer_reviews.text: This Arlo Ultra camera system does everything advertised. It was easy to setup, pairing and configurations were automatic, lots of support available - I really didn't need any to set mine up.The only disappointment I have is the WI-FI range of the system. The Cameras ability to stream 4K, and response time is based on the WI-FI connection between it, and the HUB. So although i can get good connection and signal strength between the two, I cant seem to find a location to have the excellent connection required. This does not affect its ability to detect motion and capture a clip.. it does affect real time functions like two-way audio and live viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Scot Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Nice set up but don’t see how it’s 4k
customer_reviews.text: This camera set up isn’t bad, very easy to set up and picture quality is good, but don’t see how it’s 4k. When you zoom in, you can’t make out hardly any facial details
customer_reviews.author: FireGoat

customer_reviews.title: Best camera system yet !
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up a child could do it. Many more customizable features than most. Brilliant, clear pictures day or night. With or without spot . Tracking features are “spot on” ( pun intended) Love my Arlo
customer_reviews.author: Rd reese

customer_reviews.title: Some improvements...but probably not worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: The new 4K system works fine and has a few added features, but the upgrade in quality is probably not worth the price. If you're more on a budget, I'd stick with the Arlo Pro. If money is no object, then upgrade to the 4K Arlo Ultra.
customer_reviews.author: The Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Live footage has a 20 second delay
customer_reviews.text: When watching live footage, I will be waving outside and move indoors and about 20 seconds later, I see myself waving. If I need to see live footage of something bad happening, having a 20 second delay is not very helpful. In reading reviews, I was told this was not a problem, but I guess it is for me. Also, the battery dies way to quick and only one power cable was included for two cameras. This was not very helpful. Not too impressed so far. The picture looks okay, but doesn't appear to look 4K.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Motion detection works great after some adjustment to avoid wind blown tree branches. Ability to stream locally and download in full quality from local 128 GB SD card covers our requirement for having ID quality images for suspicious people or vehicles far from the camera location. Ability for other family members to access footage through versatile cross platform interface satisfies elderly relatives concerned about "having to change the tapes"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
